definition: to smudge (become smeared)/to smudge (create a blurred effect)/shading (wash painting technique)
confused/dizzy/giddy/to faint/to swoon/to lose consciousness/to pass out
to dye/to catch (a disease)/to acquire (bad habits etc)/to contaminate/to add color washes to a painting

sentences.english: This makeup does not get splotchy and stays very natural looking all day.
sentences.chinese: 它不容易暈染，能夠一整天都保持非常自然的妝效。

sentences.english: The quick drying formula means it won't smudge.
sentences.chinese: 獨特的超快乾配方，讓你的眼線不會暈染或結塊。

sentences.english: After being delineated with thin lines, the petals were dyed with colors layer upon layer, which endowed them with varieties and a stereo impression.
sentences.chinese: 花瓣用細筆勾描後多層暈染，富有層次變化和立體感。

sentences.english: Designed to be worn alone or layered for more depth.
sentences.chinese: 可單獨使用或是深層暈染。

definition: shade (of a color, i.e. light or dark)
to paint/to smear/to apply (makeup etc)/to doodle/to erase/to obliterate
vein lines (in marble or fingerprint)/grain (in wood etc)
venation (pattern of veins on a leaf)
to arrange/to spread out/to narrate in detail/to describe at great length/to elaborate
